title: What channel is Liverpool vs Arsenal on? TV and live stream information
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest football stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

A trip to Liverpool is probably not what the doctor ordered for an Arsenal team desperate to turn their fortunes around.

The Gunners are in meltdown after blowing a two-goal lead to Crystal Palace and seeing their captain Granit Xhaka storm off the pitch in an x-rated outburst.

Unai Emery is under immense pressure to keep his job amid the recent poor form - and facing Anfield will likely do nothing to improve the mood.

Liverpool are flying once again after turning the tables in their game against Tottenham , eventually securing the three points.

Here is the key information you need ahead of the game...

(Image: Getty Images)

When is the game?

The game will start on Wednesday 30th October 2019. The kick-off time is at 19:30 GMT.

Where is the game being played?

The game will be played at Liverpool’s home stadium, Anfield. A sell-out crowd of over 54,000 is expected.

What TV channel is the game on?

The game will be shown on Sky Sports Football.

Can you live stream the game?

The game will be live streamed for Sky subscribers on the SkyGo app.

Alternatively, you can follow all of the action on the Mirror Football live blog.

Liverpool team news

Mo Salah is expected to be out for another week with an ankle problem and will not feature.

Xherdan Shaqiri is out with a calf problem and will miss the next two weeks at least.

Young goalkeeper Caoimhin Kelleher will continue in goal.

Arsenal team news

Granit Xhaka is unlikely to feature for Arsenal.

David Luiz, Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang and Calum Chambers have all not travelled to the game with Arsenal.

Mesut Ozil has been included in the squad but it is unclear whether or not he will feature.

Reiss Nelson is currently out with a ligament injury in his left knee. He is likely to be out for another month.

Betting odds

Liverpool: 17/20

Draw: 14/5

Arsenal: 3/1

Odds courtesy of thepools.com
description: Liverpool are back to winning ways after coming from behind against Tottenham - and now they turn their attention to Arsenal
